bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The notebooks have been compiled by the Beardsley Library from primary and secondary sources to document the history of Winsted, Connecticut. Settled in 1750, the city of Winsted was formed at the junction of the Mad River and Still River, and was one of the first mill towns in Connecticut. The city is within the town of Winchester, and its name derives from the fact that it is the business center for the towns of Winchester and Barkhamsted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The notebooks contain correspondence, maps, newspaper articles, pamphlets, photographs, postcards, etc., relating to business and industry, clubs and organizations, government, landscape, people, etc. of the town of Winchester and city of Winsted.
Epidemics, Pest House, and Town Farm
On Winsted and Winchester by Verna Gilson
Past is Prologue - V. S. Charette
Winsted and Winchester Brochures and Pamphlets

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are in 3-ring binders and are arranged in alphabetical order, according to topic. Pages are in acid-free protective sleeves. Notebooks are stored on a designated shelf.
